#summary Where to download the binary packages of this project.
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy

= Introduction =

This page collects the information of binary packages of this project built by community. If you built and are maintaining binary package for a specific operating system which is not listed here, feel free to contact us to add the link here, so that other users can find and download your package easily.

== openSUSE ==

=== Choice one ===
YaST repositories:
 * openSUSE 11.0: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/suzhe/openSUSE_11.0/
 * openSUSE 10.3: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/suzhe/openSUSE_10.3/

Add the repository for your system, and install either google-gadgets-gtk or google-gadgets-qt package as you want.

=== Choice two ===
YaST repositories:
 * openSUSE 11.0: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/hfiguiere/openSUSE_11.0/
 * openSUSE 10.3: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/hfiguiere/openSUSE_10.3/

Add the repository for your system, and install either google-gadgets-gtk or google-gadgets-qt package as you want.

Either of above two choices is ok, you can choose one of them.

== Ubuntu 8.04 ==
You can find binary package for xUbuntu 8.04 at: http://www.getdeb.net/app/Google+Gadgets

== Debian sid ==
We are woking on the binary package for Debian, stay tuned.

== Mandriva ==
You can find google-gadgets in contrib repository of Mandriva >= 2008.1. You may want to enable backports repository if you want to get the latest version of google-gadgets.

A simple 'urpmi google-gadgets' command will get it installed. Choose the host you want, the gtk or the qt one. 

== Fedora ==
Yum repositories:
 * Fedora 9: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/suzhe/Fedora_9/
 * Fedora 8: Not ready yet.

Add the repository for your system, and install either google-gadgets-gtk or google-gadgets-qt package as you want.
